alert.note: Alert for Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 17 at 4:13AM CDT until October 17 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING TODAY... .A cold north flow across Lake Superior will generate periods of lake-effect snow showers today. The combination of snow and some blowing and drifting snow, and this being the first significant snowfall of the season will likely result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and some blowing and drifting snow expected. Additional snow accumulation ranging from 3 to 6 inches in northern Vilas county to 1 to 3 inches in the south. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Vilas County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall overnight generally melted on the pavement due to temperatures near or a little above freezing. The arrival of colder air will result in more snow sticking to pavement this morning.
info.instruction: This being the first significant snowfall of the season, plan extra travel into any trips today. Be sure to slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
